content:
HttpRequestWrapper Class

Definition

Encapsulates the HTTP intrinsic object that enables ASP.NET to read the HTTP values that are sent by a client during a Web request.

In this Article

public class HttpRequestWrapper : System.Web.HttpRequestBase
Inheritance
Object
System.Web.HttpRequestBase
HttpRequestWrapper

Inherited Members

Equals(Object)
Equals(Object,Object)
GetHashCode()
GetType()
MemberwiseClone()
ReferenceEquals(Object,Object)
ToString()

Remarks

The HttpRequestWrapper class derives from the HttpRequestBase class and serves as a wrapper for the HttpRequest class. This class exposes the functionality of the HttpRequest class and exposes the HttpRequestBase type. The HttpRequestBase class enables you to replace the original implementation of the HttpRequest class in your application with a custom implementation, such as when you perform unit testing outside the ASP.NET pipeline.

Constructors

HttpRequestWrapper(HttpRequest)

Initializes a new instance of the HttpRequestWrapper class by using the specified request object.

public HttpRequestWrapper (System.Web.HttpRequest httpRequest);
httpRequest
HttpRequest

The object that this wrapper class provides access to.

Exceptions
ArgumentNullException

httpRequest is null.

Properties

AcceptTypes

Gets an array of client-supported MIME accept types.

public override string[] AcceptTypes { get; }
Value
String[]

An array of client-supported MIME accept types.

AnonymousID

Gets the anonymous identifier for the user, if it is available.

public override string AnonymousID { get; }
Value
String

The current anonymous user identifier.

ApplicationPath

Gets the virtual path of the root of the ASP.NET application on the server.

public override string ApplicationPath { get; }
Value
String

The virtual root path of the current application.

AppRelativeCurrentExecutionFilePath

Gets the virtual path of the application root and makes it relative by using the tilde (~) notation for the application root (as in "~/page.aspx").

public override string AppRelativeCurrentExecutionFilePath { get; }
Value
String

The virtual path of the application root for the current request with the tilde operator added.

Browser

Gets information about the requesting client's browser capabilities.

public override System.Web.HttpBrowserCapabilitiesBase Browser { get; }
Value
HttpBrowserCapabilitiesBase

An object that represents the capabilities of the client browser.

ClientCertificate

Gets the current request's client security certificate.

public override System.Web.HttpClientCertificate ClientCertificate { get; }
Value
HttpClientCertificate

The client's security certificate.

ContentEncoding

Gets or sets the character set of the data that was provided by the client.

public override System.Text.Encoding ContentEncoding { get; set; }
Value
Encoding

The client's character set.

ContentLength

Gets the length, in bytes, of content that was sent by the client.

public override int ContentLength { get; }
Value
Int32

The length, in bytes, of content that was sent by the client.

ContentType

Gets or sets the MIME content type of the request.

public override string ContentType { get; set; }
Value
String

The MIME content type of the request, such as "text/html".

Cookies

Gets the collection of cookies that were sent by the client.

public override System.Web.HttpCookieCollection Cookies { get; }
Value
HttpCookieCollection

The client's cookies.

CurrentExecutionFilePath

Gets the virtual path of the current request.

public override string CurrentExecutionFilePath { get; }
Value
String

The virtual path of the page handler that is currently executing.

Remarks

The CurrentExecutionFilePath property returns the file path of the currently executing page handler.

When you redirect a request using either the Execute method or the Transfer method, the CurrentExecutionFilePath property returns the path of the page that you are redirecting to (the child page).

FilePath

Gets the virtual path of the current request.

public override string FilePath { get; }
Value
String

The virtual path of the current request.

Files

Gets the collection of files that were uploaded by the client, in multipart MIME format.

public override System.Web.HttpFileCollectionBase Files { get; }
Value
HttpFileCollectionBase

The files that were uploaded by the client. The items in the HttpFileCollection object are of type HttpPostedFile.

Filter

Gets or sets the filter to use when the current input stream is being read.

public override System.IO.Stream Filter { get; set; }
Value
Stream

An object to use as the filter.

Form

Gets the collection of form variables that were sent by the client.

public override System.Collections.Specialized.NameValueCollection Form { get; }
Value
NameValueCollection

The form variables.

Headers

Gets the collection of HTTP headers that were sent by the client.

public override System.Collections.Specialized.NameValueCollection Headers { get; }
Value
NameValueCollection

The request headers.

HttpMethod

Gets the HTTP data-transfer method (such as GET, POST, or HEAD) that was used by the client.

public override string HttpMethod { get; }
Value
String

The HTTP data-transfer method that was used by the client.

InputStream

Gets the contents of the incoming HTTP entity body.

public override System.IO.Stream InputStream { get; }
Value
Stream

The contents of the incoming HTTP content body.

IsAuthenticated

Gets a value that indicates whether the request has been authenticated.

public override bool IsAuthenticated { get; }
Value
Boolean

true if the request has been authenticated; otherwise, false.

IsLocal

Gets a value that indicates whether the request is from the local computer.

public override bool IsLocal { get; }
Value
Boolean

true if the request is from the local computer; otherwise, false.

IsSecureConnection

Gets a value that indicates whether the HTTP connection uses secure sockets (HTTPS protocol).

public override bool IsSecureConnection { get; }
Value
Boolean

true if the connection is an SSL connection that uses HTTPS protocol; otherwise, false.

Item(String)

Gets the specified object from the stem.Web.HttpRequest.Cookies*, stem.Web.HttpRequest.Form*, stem.Web.HttpRequest.QueryString*, or stem.Web.HttpRequest.ServerVariables* collections.

public override string this[string key] { get; }
key
String

The name of the collection member to get.

Value
String

The stem.Web.HttpRequest.QueryString*, stem.Web.HttpRequest.Form*, stem.Web.HttpRequest.Cookies*, or stem.Web.HttpRequest.ServerVariables* collection member that is specified by key. If the specified key value is not found, null is returned.

LogonUserIdentity

Gets the WindowsIdentity type for the current user.

public override System.Security.Principal.WindowsIdentity LogonUserIdentity { get; }
Value
WindowsIdentity

The identity for the current user.

Params

Gets a combined collection of stem.Web.HttpRequest.QueryString*, stem.Web.HttpRequest.Form*, stem.Web.HttpRequest.ServerVariables*, and stem.Web.HttpRequest.Cookies* items.

public override System.Collections.Specialized.NameValueCollection Params { get; }
Value
NameValueCollection

The collection of combined values.

Path

Gets the virtual path of the current request.

public override string Path { get; }
Value
String

The virtual path of the current request.

PathInfo

Gets additional path information for a resource that has a URL extension.

public override string PathInfo { get; }
Value
String

The additional path information for the resource.

Remarks

For the URL Http://www.contoso.com/virdir/page.html/tail, the PathInfo value is /tail.

PhysicalApplicationPath

Gets the physical file-system path of the current application's root directory.

public override string PhysicalApplicationPath { get; }
Value
String

The file-system path of the current application's root directory.

PhysicalPath

Gets the physical file-system path of the requested resource.

public override string PhysicalPath { get; }
Value
String

The file-system path of the requested resource.

QueryString

Gets the collection of HTTP query-string variables.

public override System.Collections.Specialized.NameValueCollection QueryString { get; }
Value
NameValueCollection

The query-string variables that were sent by the client in the URL of the current request.

RawUrl

Gets the complete URL of the current request.

public override string RawUrl { get; }
Value
String

The complete URL of the current request.

RequestType

Gets or sets the HTTP data-transfer method (GET or POST) that was used by the client.

public override string RequestType { get; set; }
Value
String

The HTTP data-transfer method type that was used by the client.

ServerVariables

Gets a collection of Web server variables.

public override System.Collections.Specialized.NameValueCollection ServerVariables { get; }
Value
NameValueCollection

The server variables.

TotalBytes

Gets the number of bytes in the current input stream.

public override int TotalBytes { get; }
Value
Int32

The number of bytes in the input stream.

Url

Gets information about the URL of the current request.

public override Uri Url { get; }
Value
Uri

An object that contains information about the URL of the current request.

UrlReferrer

Gets information about the URL of the client request that linked to the current URL.

public override Uri UrlReferrer { get; }
Value
Uri

The URL of the page that linked to the current request.

UserAgent

Gets the complete user-agent string of the client.

public override string UserAgent { get; }
Value
String

The complete user-agent string of the client.

UserHostAddress

Gets the IP host address of the client.

public override string UserHostAddress { get; }
Value
String

The IP address of the client.

UserHostName

Gets the DNS name of the client.

public override string UserHostName { get; }
Value
String

The DNS name of the client.

UserLanguages

Gets a sorted array of client language preferences.

public override string[] UserLanguages { get; }
Value
String[]

A sorted array of client language preferences, or null if the array is empty.

Methods

BinaryRead(Int32)

Performs a binary read of a specified number of bytes from the current input stream.

public override byte[] BinaryRead (int count);
count
Int32

The number of bytes to read.

Returns
Byte[]

An array that contains the binary data.

Exceptions
ArgumentOutOfRangeException

count is less than 0.

- or -

count is greater than the number of bytes available.

MapImageCoordinates(String)

Maps an incoming image-field form parameter to appropriate x-coordinate and y-coordinate values.

public override int[] MapImageCoordinates (string imageFieldName);
imageFieldName
String

The name of the image map.

Returns
Int32[]

A two-dimensional array of integers.

MapPath(String)

Maps the specified virtual path to a physical path on the server.

public override string MapPath (string virtualPath);
virtualPath
String

The virtual path (absolute or relative) to map to a physical path.

Returns
String

The physical path on the server that is specified by virtualPath.

MapPath(String,String,Boolean)

Maps the specified virtual path to a physical path on the server.

public override string MapPath (string virtualPath, string baseVirtualDir, bool allowCrossAppMapping);
virtualPath
String

The virtual path (absolute or relative) to map to a physical path.

baseVirtualDir
String

The virtual base directory path that is used for relative resolution.

allowCrossAppMapping
Boolean

true to indicate that virtualPath can belong to another application; otherwise, false.

Returns
String

The physical path on the server.

Exceptions
HttpException

No HttpContext object is defined for the request.

SaveAs(String,Boolean)

Saves an HTTP request to disk.

public override void SaveAs (string filename, bool includeHeaders);
filename
String

The physical drive path.

includeHeaders
Boolean

A value that specifies whether to save HTTP headers to disk.

ValidateInput()

Causes validation to occur for the collections that are accessed through the stem.Web.HttpRequest.Cookies*, stem.Web.HttpRequest.Form*, and stem.Web.HttpRequest.QueryString* properties.

public override void ValidateInput ();

Remarks

The HttpRequest class uses input validation flags to determine whether to perform validation on the request collections that are accessed through the Cookies, Form, and QueryString properties. The ValidateInput method sets these flags so that when the get accessors of the Cookies, Form, or QueryString properties are invoked, input validation is performed. Validation works by checking all input data against a hard-coded list of potentially dangerous data.
